verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.
verses.ct: When Samuel grew old, he appointed his sons as judges over Israel.

verses.kjv: Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abiah: they were judges in Beersheba.
verses.ct: His firstborn son was named Joel, and his second son was named Abiah. They served as judges in Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
verses.ct: But his sons didn't follow his example. Instead, they chased after dishonest profit, accepted bribes, and twisted justice.

verses.kjv: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah,
verses.ct: So all the elders of Israel came together and went to Samuel at Ramah.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.
verses.ct: They told him, "Look, you're getting old, and your sons don't follow your example. Appoint a king to lead us, like all the other nations have."

verses.kjv: But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Samuel was deeply troubled when they said, "Give us a king to lead us." So Samuel prayed to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not reign over them.
verses.ct: The LORD told Samuel, "Listen to everything the people are saying to you. They haven't rejected you — they've rejected me as their ruler.

verses.kjv: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, wherewith they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee.
verses.ct: This is consistent with everything they've done from the day I brought them out of Egypt until now. They've abandoned me and worshiped other gods, and now they're doing the same thing to you.

verses.kjv: Now therefore hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest solemnly unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall reign over them.
verses.ct: So go ahead and listen to them. But give them a serious warning and explain to them what a king who rules over them will do."

verses.kjv: And Samuel told all the words of the LORD unto the people that asked of him a king.
verses.ct: Samuel passed along everything the LORD had said to the people who were demanding a king.

verses.kjv: And he said, This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: He will take your sons, and appoint them for himself, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and some shall run before his chariots.
verses.ct: He said, "Here's what a king who rules over you will do: He'll take your sons and assign them to his chariots and cavalry, and some will run ahead of his chariots as guards.

verses.kjv: And he will appoint him captains over thousands, and captains over fifties; and will set them to ear his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and instruments of his chariots.
verses.ct: He'll appoint some as commanders over 1,000 soldiers and others over 50. He'll force some to plow his fields and harvest his crops, and others to manufacture his weapons and chariot equipment.

verses.kjv: And he will take your daughters to be confectionaries, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.
verses.ct: He'll take your daughters to work as perfume makers, cooks, and bakers.

verses.kjv: And he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to his servants.
verses.ct: He'll seize your best fields, vineyards, and olive groves and hand them over to his officials.

verses.kjv: And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants.
verses.ct: He'll take a 10th of your grain and your grape harvest and give it to his officers and staff.

verses.kjv: And he will take your menservants, and your maidservants, and your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put them to his work.
verses.ct: He'll take your male and female servants, your finest young men, and your donkeys and put them all to work for himself.

verses.kjv: He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his servants.
verses.ct: He'll take a 10th of your flocks, and you yourselves will become his servants.

verses.kjv: And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king which ye shall have chosen you; and the LORD will not hear you in that day.
verses.ct: When that day comes, you'll cry out for relief from the king you chose for yourselves, but the LORD won't answer you then."

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel; and they said, Nay; but we will have a king over us;
verses.ct: But the people refused to listen to Samuel. "No!" they said. "We want a king over us!

verses.kjv: That we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.
verses.ct: Then we'll be like all the other nations, with a king to lead us, march at our head, and fight our wars."

verses.kjv: And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of the LORD.
verses.ct: Samuel listened to everything the people said, then repeated it all to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said to Samuel, Hearken unto their voice, and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel, Go ye every man unto his city.
verses.ct: The LORD told Samuel, "Go ahead and give them what they want — appoint a king for them." Then Samuel told the men of Israel, "Everyone go back to your own town."
